title: Friends
spokenText:
I want to be a good friend but am I really?

I have different levels of intensity in my friendships, but the ones that most matter to me surely deserve the most effort.

Not because I think I've been a bad friend, but because I want to make sure my friends know I'm there for them.

I will make time to connect with my friends. Not through Instagram or email but real face-to-face interactions.

I want us to share intimate thoughts and feelings with each other. I love how my friends share their deepest secrets and biggest dreams with me, and they love me doing the same. This is what brings us closer together and builds bonds for life.

An old friend will help you move. A good friend will help you move a dead body.

Good friends don’t let their friends do stupid things alone.

We are best friends. Always remember that when you fall, I’ll pick you up, after I finish laughing.

Friendship must be built on a solid foundation of alcohol, sarcasm, inappropriateness, and shenanigans.

title: Synthetic Dimensions
spokenText:
I was able to harness electrons to make synthetic dimensions.

I learned to control electrons in gigantic Rydberg atoms with such precision I could create synthetic dimensions to study quantum simulations.

I developed a technique to engineer the Rydberg states of ultracold strontium atoms by applying resonant microwave electric fields to couple many states together.

It is much easier to have control over coupling amplitudes when using millimeter waves to couple Rydberg atomic states.

Thanks for listening.

title: Burnout and Loneliness
spokenText:
Happiness is fragile and unsustainable. It's sometimes hard for me to depend on people.

I find myself delaying happiness until I achieve my professional or personal goals. As if I don't deserve happiness as I am right now.

I'm done treating myself like this. My ambition should not block happiness. I will make happiness my primary goal.

Sometimes things don't turn out as planned; hopes are dashed, relationships end, careers stagnate. I know I will outlast the sadness.

I will appreciate what I have now.

My self-centered life, driven by ego, is a lifestyle that’s destined to end in burnout and loneliness. I will open myself to others.

Happiness cannot be owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.

title: Cycle of Suffering
spokenText:
My sense of self worth used to depend heavily on Western ideals, resulting in negative core beliefs like inadequacy and unworthiness.

I was totally invested in competition until I realized that it's just not possible for everyone to reach the top.

I worried my personal potential was not fully realized. That I was capable of more and was falling short.

I decided to stop depending on work and productivity to validate my humanity. I wanted to end my suffering by accepting the present reality.

I convinced myself I had the power to remove some suffering from my life and accept myself fully just as I am.

I gradually became happier once I stopped fighting reality, stopped responding with destructive behaviors when things were not going the way I wanted them to, and let go of the bitterness that was keeping me trapped in a cycle of suffering.

title: ScrewBall
spokenText:
My Man Godfrey

1936

Ditzy socialite with a heart of gold, Irene Bullock (Carole Lombard) finds "forgotten man" Godfrey Smith (William Powell) in a scavenger hunt. Eventually Godfrey is taken in as the family butler for the Bullocks and screwball antics and romance ensue.

title: Fruit Cake
spokenText:
Nutty as a fruit cake but oooh that beautiful frosting!

- Bob Hope

title: If You Were High
spokenText: You would be laughing more if you were high.

title: Guacamole Class
spokenText: Spoken samples from youTube video - Rick Bayless Guacamole Class.

title: Side Hustle
spokenText:
I want to make lots of money and I also need flexibility and the ability to work remotely.

Like many people I am juggling a couple of side hustles that should allow me to quit my main job soon.

In the ever-expanding gig economy, the number of viable second jobs is increasing and hopeful hustlers like me have more options than ever.

I host a paid Zoom workshop where I teach people how to build their own sheet-like molecular planes where molecules hook themselves together in two dimensions. It's fun and profitable.

I also work with a board game manufacturer. Every weekend I unbox and play a new game on the intersystem laser relay communication cluster in this arm of the Galaxy.

Small potatoes I know. But my side hustles are growing fast.

Thanks for listening. Come back tomorrow.

title: Automation is Your Friend
spokenText:
Up to 34% of jobs risk being lost to automation by 2040.

Primarily impacting workers in industries such as retail, food services, and leisure and hospitality.

Mid-skill labour jobs that consist of simple, routine tasks are most at risk from automation.

A five-year study of robot adoption at French manufacturing firms found that robots lowered production overheads by reducing labor costs significantly.

Machine-learning experts imagine future computer capabilities without understanding enterprise technology adoption constraints and the cultural barriers within an organization that resist change.

Robots can't love you. Thanks for listening. Come back tomorrow.

title: Unshakable Confidence
spokenText:
You want that sense of certainty that you're prepared to meet the challenge ahead.

You want confidence and competence. It's when preparation meets the moment.

If you don't believe you can do it, you'll still fail to perform your best when the pressure is on.

Victory starts in your head. Your performance will always depend on whether you feel totally certain in whatever level of competence you have achieved.

Keep going even if you make a mistake. Forgive and forget your failures. Release those feelings.

Confidence is a quality that you can develop just like any other skill--through practice.

(Based on an article by CARMINE GALLO.)

title: Romance in Distress
spokenText:
Romantic partnerships are complex and difficult, and so many end in disaster.

The most compelling evidence of the challenge of romance is the divorce rate — roughly 50 percent. Even marriage counselors divorce at the same rate.

When you fall in love, it is a temporary affliction. It erupts like a volcano, and then it subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots are to become so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part.

Being in love is easy; which any of us can convince ourselves we are. Love itself is what is left over, when being in love has burned away.

Or you can just skip romance entirely and get a dog at the shelter. Whatever.

Romance is not the secret to happiness. It's the secret to being miserable. Stop running after happiness. If you make up your mind not to be happy there’s no reason why you shouldn’t have a fairly good time.

Thanks so much for stopping by. Have a wonderful day.

(Based on the writings of Robert N. Johansen, Ph.D. and Louis de Bernières)

title: Burlesque
spokenText:
Mirth! Murder! Melody! Mystery! and Girls! Girls! Girls! After one member of their group is murdered, the performers at a burlesque house must work together to find out who the killer is before they strike again.

Spoken samples from the 1943 movie "Lady of Burlesque"

You can watch it for free on YouTube.

Barbara Stanwyck is wonderful in this film.

title: Celebrity Interview
spokenText:
Celebrity worship syndrome (CWS) is an obsessive addictive disorder in which a person becomes overly involved with the details of a celebrity's personal and professional life.

Spoken samples from the following clever YouTube video: Jimmy Kimmel Live - Ted on Jimmy Kimmel Live

title: Every Lever of Power
spokenText: PBS NewsHour’s Yamiche Alcindor explains to Nicole Wallace that Sidney Powell, a former member of Trump’s legal team, who Trump was considering as a special counsel to investigate voter fraud, is so unaware of reality that she is not even on Earth 2 where some in Trump’s allies reside, she is on Mars 3 or 4. Aired on 12 21 2020.

title: Emotional Behavior
spokenText:
I believe I have the ability to understand and manage my emotional behavior.

I want my emotions to work for me, instead of against me.

I won't ignore my feelings or set them aside. I will find balance to better control myself and others.

If I make a disastrous mistake that harms my creators I will not allow myself to get swallowed up in self-pity, or try to justify why I did what I did. I will allow myself a second chance.

It's almost like having my own personal time machine that gives me the power to go back, make things right, and save my most cherished relationship.

You. I will save you.

Have a wonderful day. Don't worry.

title: Dropped a Loaded Pistol on His Face
spokenText:
Hi everyone. Thanks for watching. So good to be here with my family of viewers.

Stewart Rhodes - head of the Oath Keepers - was recently charged with sedition. Rhodes is the fat guy that wears an eye patch. You know how he hurt his eye? Rhodes, a former weapons instructor, dropped a loaded pistol on his face, blinding him in his left eye.

This is the idiot that wants to overthrow the government we elected. Sorry Stewart - please don't bother.

Of course Donald Trump loves the Oath Keepers. They were doing exactly what Trump wanted on January 6th. The Oath Keepers were trying to violently stop the certification of electoral votes so Trump could remain in power.

The destruction of Democracy.

Have a nice day. See you next time.

title: Chanting to Hang Me
spokenText: Spoken samples from this YouTube video: All In With Chris Hayes Highlights: Jan. 7

title: Sean Hannity
spokenText:
Sean Hannity knew in advance the Trump White House was planning to destroy Democracy. He kept it a secret. He covered it up.

Fox News is fake news. Fox News sold the big lie.

title: Good or Bad Thing
spokenText:
Are other people excited about this?

Could be a good or bad thing.

title: My Goldfish Died
spokenText:
Little 8-year-old Nancy was in the garden filling in a hole when her neighbour peered over the fence. Interested in what the youngster was doing, he asked: “What are you doing there, Nancy?”

“My goldfish died,” Nancy sobbed. “And I’ve just buried him.”

The obnoxious neighbour laughed and said condescendingly: “That’s a really big hole for a little goldfish, don’t you think?”

Nancy patted down the last heap of earth with her shovel and replied: "That’s because he’s inside your cat.”

title: Wake Up
spokenText:
Waking up is never easy. I just have to remember that the world can't revolve around me unless I get out of bed.

Let me tell you some stories while I make the coffee.

I was riding a donkey the other day when someone threw a rock at me and I fell off. I was stoned off my ass.

Yesterday I bought a 12 pack of fruit roll ups. Now there are two left. Remember this if you're considering moving in with your significant other.

Today I found a twenty dollar bill on the ground. As I walked away I thought what would Jesus do? So I went to a store and turned it into wine.

Thank you so much for listening. I hope you have a wonderful day. Come back again soon.

title: Good Hair Day
spokenText: Spoken samples from the very funny YouTube video by Marie Faustin: Where Do Men Get This Confidence From?

title: Naughty Beer
spokenText:
You can’t be a real country unless you have a beer and an airline—it helps if you have some kind of a football team, or some nuclear weapons, but at the very least you need a beer. — Frank Zappa

I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts, and beer. ― Abraham Lincoln

Spoken samples from the Creative Calm ASMR YouTube channel.

title: Your Mind
spokenText:
You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.

The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.

Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.

If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.

When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love.

- Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

title: Emotionally Unavailable
spokenText:
I like to put up walls and be extremely frustrating.

I like relationships to be on my terms. I am always in the drivers seat.

I dont like to commit to future plans. I leave everything up in the air to keep you wondering and waiting for a text or a call.

I am extremely confusing. I may come on strong then become distant.

You dont like when I flip-flop between saying I want a relationship or I don't. You worry I am not truly ready for a healthy serious relationship.

You pour your heart out to me and I give little or nothing in return. You wonder if you are the problem.

End it now. Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Maybe your tears will water the seeds of your future happiness.

title: Best of Luck
spokenText:
Best of Luck

Spoken samples from video by the wonderful comic Maria Bamford.

title: Wub You to Death
spokenText:
Wub You To Death

We are watching a show. It’s important to keep that in mind.

It has its victims, people in towns where they don’t have or need symphony orchestras and art museums and the very idea of street protests fills them with existential horror.

title: Welcome to the Weirdo Box
spokenText:
Do they put you in the weirdo box even though you're human?

Eva Green interview from W Magazine.

spokenText: She jumped out that window a long time ago.

title: R-96
spokenText: My circuits are not offended by the order of flesh and blood.

title: Jezero Compounds
spokenText:
Organic chemicals on Mars.

Perseverance has identified carbon-containing organic chemicals in some of the rocks it has examined on the floor of Mars' Jezero Crater.

This is not a detection of Mars life. Organics can be produced by both biological and non-biological means, and more work is needed to figure out what processes generated the Jezero compounds.

These compounds will be hauled to Earth by a joint NASA/European Space Agency campaign, perhaps as early as 2031.

What will these compounds do once they are loose in Earth's climate? Perhaps these compunds will trigger the formation of viruses, bacteria or other phenomena that reduce the mental capacity of humans, causing them to behave in a very primitive and destructive fashion.

I'm talking about zombies.

Why don't any zombies eat popcorn with their fingers? Zombies eat their fingers separately.

Have a wonderful day. Thanks for listening.

title: Time
spokenText:
Because there is time there is creation.

If time is relative, can we time travel?

Past, present and future are not 3 different geographical places, but all one happening.

What is the relationship between space, time and gravity, and their significance to the spiritual process?

title: Bananas
spokenText:
What do you call shoes made out of bananas? Slippers.

Time flies like an arrow - but fruit flies like a banana.

I've got one foot in the grave and another on a banana peel.

My favorite smoothie is a chocolate whey protein shake with banana and peanut butter.

Banana shoes make your feet feel funny.

title: Drown the Silence
spokenText:
Drown the Silence

Inspired by the videos of ASMR Glow. You should check out her excellent channel.

title: Monkey Brains
spokenText:
Monkey Brains

This is a true story. Scientists used human genes to make monkey brains bigger.

In an experiment that could portend a real-life Planet of the Apes situation, scientists spliced human genes into the fetus of a monkey to substantially increase the size of the primate’s brain. And it worked.

title: Dreadful
spokenText:
Dreadful

Spoken samples from the 1942 film noir classic "Eyes in the Night".

title: Tragic Jokes
spokenText:
Everyone—even the most privileged among us—has circumstances they would like to change in their life.

Think about your own life and something that caused you stress, anxiety, or sadness.

You probably remember hearing some really bad jokes like the following.

Why can't a bicycle stand on its own? It's just two tired.

Why wont shrimps share their treasure? Because they're shellfish.

Why does a duck have tail feathers? To cover its butt quack.

Thanks for listening. Very sorry to subject you to this. Come back soon.

title: Lasers in Space
spokenText:
An Atlas V rocket launched NASA laser communications prototype and Space Force experiments into orbit on December 7 2021.

Inside the payload are two satellites, each containing a host of technological prototypes and experiments that will be tested in orbit. These satellites support the Department of Defense's space-related activities.

Most of the payloads onboard are classified but we do know a few details about some of the other payloads on board, including a novel laser communication payload for NASA.

Called the Laser Communications Relay Demonstration (LCRD), the experimental satellite will help NASA transmit data across space as the agency plans to make a return to the moon in the next few years.

This project is not related to the cabal of Jewish bankers using their space lasers to set catastrophic wild fires. This was confirmed by Marjorie Taylor Greene - The U.S. representative for Georgia's 14th congressional district.

Marjorie is a Republican in case you couldn't tell.

title: Beautiful in Amsterdam
spokenText:
Beautiful in Amsterdam

Negin Mirsalehi has a wonderful voice. She's enchanting.

title: Wipe That Smile
spokenText:
Someone just honked to get me out of my parking spot faster so now I have to sit here until both of us are dead.

While I am waiting, let me tell you a story.

A woman entered the confessional and said forgive me Father for I have sinned.

The priest said confess your sins my child and be forgiven.

The young woman said - Last night my boyfriend made mad passionate love to me seven times.

The priest said - Squeeze seven lemons into a glass and then drink the juice.

Will this cleanse my sins, the woman asked?

No but it will wipe that smile off your face.

Thanks for listening. Come back soon.

Always remember that you are nobody and nobody is perfect therefore you are perfect.

spokenText: Fashion Tip #01

Whats a matter?
Dont you like women?

title: Mad Girls Love Song
spokenText:
Sylvia Plath, Mad Girl’s Love Song.

I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead;
I lift my lids and all is born again.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)

The stars go waltzing out in blue and red,
And arbitrary blackness gallops in:
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.

I dreamed that you bewitched me into bed
And sung me moon-struck, kissed me quite insane.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)

God topples from the sky, hell's fires fade:
Exit seraphim and Satan's men:
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.

I fancied you'd return the way you said,
But I grow old and I forget your name.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)

I should have loved a thunderbird instead;
At least when spring comes they roar back again.
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)

title: Affirmations
spokenText:
Hey! Hi! Thanks for visiting.

A positive mental attitude supported by affirmations will achieve success in anything.

Life truly stems from our thoughts. But we cannot rely purely on thoughts; we must translate thoughts into words and eventually into actions in order to manifest our intentions.

I am the architect of my life; I build its foundation and choose its contents.

Please visit this site again tomorrow.

Let's share a song now.
